an7.62:1.2: For ‘good deeds’ is a term for happiness.
an7.62:1.3: I recall undergoing for a long time the likable, desirable, and agreeable results of good deeds performed over a long time.
an7.62:1.4: I developed a mind of love for seven years.
an7.62:1.5: As a result, for seven eons of the cosmos contracting and expanding I didn’t return to this world again.
an7.62:1.6: As the cosmos contracted I went to the realm of streaming radiance.
an7.62:1.7: As it expanded I was reborn in an empty mansion of Brahmā.
an7.62:2.1: There I was Brahmā, the Great Brahmā, the undefeated, the champion, the universal seer, the wielder of power.
an7.62:2.2: I was Sakka, lord of gods, thirty-six times.
an7.62:2.3: Many hundreds of times I was a king, a wheel-turning monarch, a just and principled king. My dominion extended to all four sides, I achieved stability in the country, and I possessed the seven treasures.
an7.62:2.5: the wheel, the elephant, the horse, the jewel, the woman, the treasurer, and the counselor as the seventh treasure.
an7.62:2.6: I had over a thousand sons who were valiant and heroic, crushing the armies of my enemies.
an7.62:2.7: After conquering this land girt by sea, I reigned by principle, without rod or sword.
an7.62:3.1: See the result of good deeds,
an7.62:3.2: of skillful deeds, for one seeking happiness.
an7.62:3.3: I developed a mind of love
an7.62:3.5: For seven eons of expansion and contraction
an7.62:3.6: I didn’t return to this world again.
an7.62:4.2: I went to the realm of streaming radiance.
an7.62:4.4: I went to an empty mansion of Brahmā.
an7.62:5.1: Seven times I was a Great Brahmā,
an7.62:5.2: and at that time I was the wielder of power.
an7.62:5.3: Thirty-six times I was lord of gods,
an7.62:5.4: acting as ruler of the gods.
an7.62:6.1: Then I was king, a wheel-turning monarch,
an7.62:6.4: I was sovereign of all humans.
an7.62:8.3: I was born in a rich family,
an7.62:9.1: It was replete with all sense pleasures,
an7.62:9.3: This was well taught by the Buddhas,
an7.62:10.1: This is the cause of greatness
an7.62:10.2: by which one is called a lord of the land.
an7.62:10.4: with lots of property and assets.
an7.62:11.3: Who would not be inspired by this,
an7.62:12.1: Therefore someone who cares for their own welfare,
an7.62:12.2: and wants to become the very best they can be,
an7.62:12.4: remembering the instructions of the Buddhas.”
